Is Donald Trump an Atheist?
===========================
Social Media Photo Meme Falsely Claims Donald Trump Came Out as an Atheist in 1989
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
By , Mainline Church Editor Friday, March 04, 2016]
!
A viral photo meme of Donald Trump that includes a false quote. | (Photo: Screengrab/Twitter)
A widely circulated photo meme on social media claims that Republican front runner and billionaire real estate mogul Donald Trump came out as an atheist back in 1989.
!
Republican U.S. presidential candidate Donald Trump speaks as rival candidate Ted Cruz (R) winces at the U.S. Republican presidential candidates debate in Detroit, Michigan, March 3, 2016. | (Photo: REUTERS/Jim Young)
According to the meme, Trump told Phil Donahue on an episode of his program in 1989 that he was too smart to believe in God.
"I have a really high IQ, Phil, I mean, c'mon. It's impossible for me to not be Atheist," , along with a photo of "The Donald" from the 1980s.
!
Get Our Latest News for FREE
----------------------------
Subscribe to get daily/weekly email with the top stories (plus special offers!) from The Christian Post. Be the first to know.
Subscribe
However, according to the research done by the anti-gossip website Snopes.com and posted on Thursday, the quote is a fabrication.
"We found no evidence that Trump uttered this phrase, and no evidence that he even appeared on The Phil Donahue Show in 1989," 
"The media mogul was a guest on the show in 1987, but there is no record of him discussing his religious views (or, more accurately, his lack thereof) during that appearance."
The viral meme came as Trump rides momentum in his campaign to become the Republican nominee for president.
On Super Tuesday, Trump won more states than all his GOP opponents combined, with primary voters in Alabama, Arkansas...[Content truncated]

website_quality_evaluation.justification: The Christian Post is a well-known news outlet focusing on Christian-related topics and events. While it provides comprehensive coverage of faith-related news, it occasionally presents content that aligns with specific theological viewpoints, which can bias reporting. Their commitment to Christian values may limit their objectivity, especially in political matters.

Relevance.Relevance Justification: This evidence directly addresses the claim about Donald Trump identifying himself as an atheist in an interview. It mentions a widely circulated meme that falsely claims Trump stated he was an atheist on the Phil Donahue show in 1989. It further explains that there is no evidence supporting that he made such a statement or even appeared on the show that year, making it very relevant to assessing the truthfulness of the original claim.

QA.Question: Did Donald Trump identify himself as an atheist in his 1989 interview with Phil Donahue?
QA.Answer: No, Donald Trump did not identify himself as an atheist in his 1989 interview with Phil Donahue. A widely circulated meme claims that Trump asserted he was too smart to believe in God during a 1989 episode of the show, stating, “I have a really high IQ, Phil. I mean, c'mon. It's impossible for me to not be Atheist.” However, investigations by fact-checking organizations like Snopes have found no evidence that Trump ever said this or that he even appeared on The Phil Donahue Show in 1989. In fact, Trump was a guest on the show in 1987, and during that appearance, there is no record of him discussing his religious beliefs or lack thereof.
